department: College of Computing and Digital Media
biography: <p>Alan Jeffrey is the head of the <a href="http://fpl.cs.depaul.edu/">Foundations of Programming Languages</a> research group.  He is a principal investigator on the <a href="http://cryptyc.cs.depaul.edu/">Cryptyc</a> project with <a href="http://www.research.microsoft.com/">Microsoft Research</a> to investigate types for cryptographically secured communications protocols; and he works with <a href="http://www.cogs.susx.ac.uk/users/julianr/">Julian Rahtke</a> on full abstraction for higher-order and object-based languages.  He is also a co-principal investigator on the Temporal Aspects project between CTI and Bell Labs, investigating feature interactions of aspect-based security security.</p><br><p>He has an undergraduate degree from the University of Edinburgh, a doctorate from Wolfson College, Oxford, and has worked at Chalmers University and the University of Sussex before coming to DePaul.</p>
